channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lime bikes, 7th October
item.description:
There are lime bikes blocking pavement and cycle stand outside Hyaat Hotel near the junction of Seymour Street and Portman Square

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Portman Square, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refuse shoot Completely blocked, 7th October
item.description:
The refuse shoot on level 5 of the middle block of Lincoln Court is completely blocked, I can not open the door more that you see in the photo as it's jammed. The smell is v bad. It has been reported as fixed but it isn't.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bethune Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge is overgrown, 7th October
item.description:
L&Q's contractors IDEVERDE has cut down their side of the edging and have advised the bit that is overgrown is bexley councils resposibility. Please can this be cut down with regular maintenance as it is coming over from the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazel Drive, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgroiwn grass & nettle in alleyway, 7th October
item.description:
Resident reporting the alleyway needs the grass cut & trimming back of the nettles & hedges. please could someone look into the job will need a strimmer -thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mera Drive, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More than 10 bikesblocking the pavement - Accessability issues, 7th October
item.description:
There are both lime and human forest bikes blocking access to our building. Please advise both comapanies to move the parking zone to strictly the island section of the road and not the pavement. Alternativelt there is a larger island which is completly vacent which would fit all rental bikes on Pall Mall. It is a roundabout with a lot of vacent unused space.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, St. James's Street, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A4 posters stapled to trees along Kyverdale Road., 7th October
item.description:
There are A4 posters stapled to several trees along Kyverdale Road, especially between Lynmouth Grove and Lampard Grove, and also to trees on Filey Avenue. They are in Hebrew but there is a web address in English.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kyverdale Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Coop using footpath as dump ground / fox visits every night, 7th October
item.description:
Hello There are foxes rummaging at night in the trolleys and dump left by Coop. Coop ideally should only have trolleys on the footpath during delivery times but trolleys outside the shop are a permanent feature. Neighbours suggest this problem has been reported to the council. Coop staff think it is how the footpath has always been used. Please could the council address this problem. Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jamaica Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant flow of water across path, 7th October
item.description:
Constant flow of water across pathway. Has been like this for months. Has been reported to Thames water on more than one occasion and nothing has been done. This will become a dangerous issue when it freezes in the winter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Mead Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Non resident parking, 7th October
item.description:
Because the gates been broken for 2 years, non residents are parking on the estate. Feels like a significant issue given how expensive parking is this central in London. Parks every day during the day, then leaves at night. Parks inconsiderately.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mapledene Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on back of building, 7th October
item.description:
Graffiti on the back of Lennie House 34 Picton Street , near play area looks horrible and not sure even what it says maybe racist's comments written nonother language or a tag. Please can Southwark council remove it .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Draycott Close, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load (Estates)

item.title: Overhanging branches, 7th October
item.description:
The branches of the large Oak tree outside number 48 Broad Oaks Way is dangerous to high sided vehicles. The branches hang down in front of the windscreen of lorries and then scrape along the whole body of the lorry leaving debris all over the road. Vans with high sides also break the branches, again leaving a trail a leaves and bark all over the road. Please can you cut these branches as a matter of urgency?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Broad Oaks Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped household items, 7th October
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
